channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hundreds arrested in immigration raid at Hyundai plant site in Georgia

Senate Democrats to probe firings of DOJ employees who worked for Jack Smith
item.description: Democrats on the Senate Judiciary Committee are asking Pam Bondi for records of at least 20 DOJ staff fired in August.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani challenges Trump to debate in New York City
item.description: Democrat Zohran Mamdani challenged President Trump to a debate in NYC after Andrew Cuomo called for a series of debates in the mayor's race.

item.title: Couple who illegally kept rooftop-roaming panther learns their fate
item.description: The ruling follows a 2019 incident when the months-old feline was seen roaming a nearby rooftop after slipping out of the couple's window.

item.title: 450 detained in raid by ICE, other agencies at huge Hyundai site in Georgia
item.description: The operation targeted one of Georgia's largest and most high-profile manufacturing sites, where Hyundai makes electric vehicles and is building an EV...

item.title: WATCH: 3-year-old boy dies after being left in hot car, police say
item.description: A 3-year-old boy has died after being left alone in a hot car outside of his home, according to authorities in Utah.

item.title: Girls fell behind boys in math during the pandemic. Schools are trying to make up lost ground
item.description: Efforts to close the gender gap in STEM education are gaining momentum after setbacks during the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Trump administration investigates Medicaid spending on immigrants in Democratic states

item.title: BLS set to release 1st jobs report since Trump fired commissioner
item.description: A weak jobs report last month showed a sharp hiring slowdown.

item.title: 'Partially decomposed' body identified after discovery by man mowing lawn

item.title: WATCH: New Jersey town council candidate breakdances to protest property tax hikes
item.description: A town council candidate in Cranford, New Jersey, pulled out some breakdancing moves during a town hall meeting to protest local property tax hikes.
